feed.title: Zitnik Lab
feed.subtitle: Harvard Machine Learning for Medicine and Science

entry.title: MedTok: Unlocking Medical Codes for GenAI

link.title: MedTok: Unlocking Medical Codes for GenAI

entry.content: Meet MedTok, a multimodal medical code tokenizer that transforms how AI understands structured medical data. By integrating textual descriptions and relational contexts, MedTok enhances tokenization for transformer-based models—powering everything from EHR foundation models to medical QA. [Project website]
entry.summary: Meet MedTok, a multimodal medical code tokenizer that transforms how AI understands structured medical data. By integrating textual descriptions and relational contexts, MedTok enhances tokenization for transformer-based models—powering everything from EHR foundation models to medical QA. [Project website]

entry.title: What If You Could Rewrite Biology? Meet CLEF

link.title: What If You Could Rewrite Biology? Meet CLEF

entry.content: What if we could anticipate molecular and medical changes before they happen? Introducing CLEF, an approach for counterfactual generation in biological and medical sequence models. [Project website]
entry.summary: What if we could anticipate molecular and medical changes before they happen? Introducing CLEF, an approach for counterfactual generation in biological and medical sequence models. [Project website]

entry.title: ProCyon AI Highlighted by Kempner
entry.content: Thanks to Kempner Institute for highlighting our latest research, ProCyon, our protein-text foundation model for modeling protein functions.
entry.summary: Thanks to Kempner Institute for highlighting our latest research, ProCyon, our protein-text foundation model for modeling protein functions.

entry.title: Foundation Model for Protein Phenotypes
entry.content: New paper: ProCyon is a groundbreaking foundation model for modeling, generating, and predicting protein phenotypes. [Project website] [Code]
entry.summary: New paper: ProCyon is a groundbreaking foundation model for modeling, generating, and predicting protein phenotypes. [Project website] [Code]

entry.title: SPECTRA in Nature Machine Intelligence
entry.content: Are biomedical AI models truly as smart as they seem? SPECTRA is a framework that evaluates models by considering the full spectrum of cross-split overlap: train-test similarity. SPECTRA reveals gaps in benchmarks for molecular sequence data across 19 models, including LLMs, GNNs, diffusion models, and conv nets.
entry.summary: Are biomedical AI models truly as smart as they seem? SPECTRA is a framework that evaluates models by considering the full spectrum of cross-split overlap: train-test similarity. SPECTRA reveals gaps in benchmarks for molecular sequence data across 19 models, including LLMs, GNNs, diffusion models, and conv nets.

entry.title: Unified Clinical Vocabulary Embeddings
entry.content: New paper: A unified resource provides a new representation of clinical knowledge by unifying medical vocabularies. (1) Phenotype risk score analysis across 4.57 million patients, (2) Inter-institutional clinician panels evaluate alignment with clinical knowledge across 90 diseases and 3,000 clinical codes.
entry.summary: New paper: A unified resource provides a new representation of clinical knowledge by unifying medical vocabularies. (1) Phenotype risk score analysis across 4.57 million patients, (2) Inter-institutional clinician panels evaluate alignment with clinical knowledge across 90 diseases and 3,000 clinical codes.
